snippet: As the police closed in on him, Mehdi Masroor Biswas gave a panicky interview to an Indian newspaper saying that his comments in interviews with Channel 4 had been misconstrued and that his email had been hacked.
abstract: Police officers in India arrest Mehdi Masroor Biswas, man accused of being behind pro-Islamic State Twitter handle ShamiWitness; publicly espousing violent or radical views is serious offense in India and can be punished with life in prison.

byline.contributor: Hari Kumar contributed reporting from New Delhi, and Ben Hubbard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: As the police closed in on him, Mehdi Masroor Biswas gave a panicky interview to an Indian newspaper saying that his comments in interviews with Channel 4 had been misconstrued and that his email had been hacked.

headline.main: Online Trail Leads to Arrest of Indian as Man Behind Posts Backing the Islamic State
